channel.title: Am I Arachnophobiac?
channel.description:
Well, lately I've been having a lot of... nightmares, I guess, about spiders. I shit myself when I see them and scream, pretty much. It all seems to of come from the time I woke up in the middle of the night and turned the light on, and looking straight at me, was a 10 centimeter(?) huntsman. I, will admit this, screamed and fell backwards. Now, in the night I keep waking up thinking there's spiders all over the well, last night was a good example.
I was asleep and dreamed I was looking at the walls and spiders came in everywhere, I jumped out of bed and looked around, in a lather of sweat.

item.title: Am I Arachnophobiac?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Just get an aerosol can of Lysol, and keep spraying that shit on them until the fuckers suffocate. Then laugh as they spaz out and die. Not only will you get a laugh, you’ll also learn that you are supreme over them, and your fear will go away

(It helped me!)
[sub][size=1pt]rap pluz pluz if it helps lol[/size][/sub]

Read full topic

item.title: Am I Arachnophobiac?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:20, topic:184452”]Hehe I hate spiders too. Before my dad renovated the cottage, they would bite you in your sleep. Or a couple of times they would drop down from the ceiling and land on you when ur lying there.

Probably not as scary as those aussie spiders, but they are these really big light brown spiders that you find on the beach often. Also they made a nest in my bathroom one time and when i peeled off some of the wallpaper(cuz i could see them going in) it was loaded with the tiniest spiders ever.

I just kill the fuckers.[/quote]
Yah. I do that, but like, fucking massive dangerous spiders here in Australia, and it’s gay. Why can I move to a soft country like England, and rape Cowie.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I Arachnophobiac?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:16, topic:184452”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=246125.msg2075484#msg2075484 date=1204050936]
Just saying, nobody eats spiders in their sleep, that’s totally a myth. Your gag reflexes would cause you to spit anything that fell into your throat out, sleeping or not. Especially if it’s a moving spider.
[/quote]

Say that to a guy who studys spiders! Isn’t it the average of like 8 spiders in the whole of your lifetime?[/quote]
Yes, that’s the gist of it, truth or not.

I hear you have many, many spiders in Aus so why don’t you buy some of that spray shit you have over there and coat your walls in it (repellent stuff).
[/quote]

Spiders also freak me out. It’s just the way they move, so fast and sleek.

item.title: Am I Arachnophobiac?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Its totally natural for humans to have a fear of spiders. It is an irrattional fear but its something to do with cavemen etc like thousands of years ago we knew that they were poisonous so obviously we were afraid of them.

I’m not too afraid of them, sure if they make me jump my initial reaction is to be scared but then i just think alright its just a spider. Though I was removing this large spider from my house a few weeks ago [Probably just a house spider] but I don’t know why when i went up to it and stared at it I sort of lost myself and the back of my brain felt like it was burning. I guess its all down to the caveman thing

Read full topic
